official-title.#text: To establish the Commission on Health Care Savings through Innovative Wireless Technologies.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a commission to be known as the

quote.#tail: (in this Act referred to as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Health Care Savings through Innovative Wireless Technologies
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Commission on Health Care Savings through Innovative Wireless Technologies

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Health Care Savings through Innovative Wireless Technologies

text.#text: Examine the cost savings to the United States health care system, if any, that can be achieved by increasing the use of wireless health information technologies (including technologies related to digital health, mobile health (mHealth), telehealth, telemedicine, e-Care, remote patient monitoring, and the collection of patient-generated health data) by patients, caregivers, and health care providers.
Examine existing scientific research studying the medical effectiveness of wireless health information technologies that deliver health care.
Examine existing payment models and incentive payment programs that provide Federal financial reimbursement or funding for the use of wireless health information technologies.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and for appropriate Federal agencies to incentivize and promote innovation and technological advancements in the area of wireless health information technologies.

text.#text: Examine barriers to marketplace entry, whether technical or systemic, that impede efforts by persons and entities to develop new wireless health information technologies and to improve existing wireless health information technologies.

Identify appropriate situations for the integration of wireless health information technologies into Federal health care programs, and recommend methods for integrating such technologies into such programs.

Develop a proposal based on the findings of its examinations under this section for the establishment, implementation, and financing of a comprehensive program to encourage the further integration of wireless health information technologies into existing Federal health care programs.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: can consider utilizing in order to more accurately assess the cost savings that the Federal Government can achieve by increasing the use of wireless health information technologies by patients, caregivers, and health care providers in the United States.

text.#text: Develop cost estimate approaches that the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be composed of 19 individuals (such as the individuals described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Health Care Savings through Innovative Wireless Technologies

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ) who have demonstrated experience or expertise with respect to wireless health information technologies and that are appointed not later than 45 days after the date of the enactment of this Act as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: minority leader of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: minority leader of the House of Representatives
majority leader of the Senate
minority leader of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services
Chairman of the Federal Communications Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , individuals described in this subsection are—

text.#text: group health plans, health insurance coverage offered in the group or individual market, and other third-party payers;
small businesses or startup companies in the wireless health information technologies industry;
major research and academic institutions; and
individuals who have received health care treatment that included the use of wireless health information technologies and caregivers of such individuals.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may be officers or employees of the Federal Government or Members of Congress.

header.#text: Prohibition on Federal officers, employees, and Members of Congress serving as members

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Health Care Savings through Innovative Wireless Technologies

text.#text: Each member shall be appointed for the life of the
Members shall serve without pay and without receipt of travel expenses.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall constitute a quorum but a lesser number may hold hearings.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Health Care Savings through Innovative Wireless Technologies

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be elected by the members.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Health Care Savings through Innovative Wireless Technologies

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall meet at the call of the Chairperson and may not meet fewer than nine times.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Health Care Savings through Innovative Wireless Technologies

text.#text: Any member or agent of the

Commission on Health Care Savings through Innovative Wireless Technologies

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: . Gifts, bequests, or devises of money and proceeds from sales of other property received as gifts, bequests, or devises shall be deposited in the Treasury and shall be available for disbursement upon order of the

Commission on Health Care Savings through Innovative Wireless Technologies
